Posts.Content: Ken wrote: we are in need of information for tried-and-proven ...alternate port-o-cath placement sites. it is an aggressive bilateral breast cancer, and the chest wall is not going to be a choice at all. external veinous access devices (e.g. hickman's, picc-lines, etc.) also not a best option in this lengthy regimen.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ? port placement alternatives ? Ken Ken

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2009 07:03PM - edited Nov 6, 2009 07:09PM by Ken okay, ...from original post then, a "cook catheter" rep for vital-ports contacted me and gave me this in regard to an alternative site for placing a port. i cannot vouch for tried & proven yet, but the fact that she responded, and the fact that there's at least one other way to go - is a great start: " Based on the information (...) it sounds like the best place for port placement (...) might be peripherally (either in the forearm or the upper arm).  Cook offers a very low profile port for this type of placement.  If (...) " so there it is. K
Posts.Title: ? port placement alternatives ? Ken Ken
